item.title: Karen add a quote by Naomi Shihab Nye
item.description: "It is really hard to be lonely very long in a world of words. Even if you don't have friends somewhere, you still have language, and it will find you and wrap its little syllables around you and suddenly there will be a story to live in. " -- Naomi Shihab Nye

item.title: Karen add a quote by Dorothy Gambrell
item.description: "If television's a babysitter, the Internet is a drunk librarian who won't shut up." -- Dorothy Gambrell

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "I always order the banned books from a black market dealer in California, figuring if the State of Mississippi banned them, they must be good." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "I always thought insanity would be a dark, bitter feeling, but it is drenching and delicious if you really roll around in it." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "My children have always existed at the deepest center of me, right there in the heart/hearth, but I struggled with the powerful demands of motherhood, chafing sometimes at the way they pulled me away from my separate life, not knowing how to balance them with my unwieldy need for solitude and creative expression." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Karen add a quote by Julia Cameron
item.description: "When we walk, the two halves of our brains converse." -- Julia Cameron

item.title: Karen add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description:
"So what are we supposed to do again, when we hate everything?
You stop pretending life is such fun or makes sense. It's often messy and cruel and dull, and we do the best we can. It's unfair, and jerks seem to win. But you fall in love with a few people. Like I love you, Elizabeth. You're the angel God sent me." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Karen add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "She never utters a sound even when she's crying, and that makes me a little sad. Doesn't seem right. When you cry, people should hear you. The world should stop." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Karen add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "How do people stay in love, anyway? Is it a choice? Or is it like those plants we studied in biology that mutate into something new and totally different but are still part of the same plant family?" -- Libba Bray

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kristen Tracy
item.description: "Dessy, don't grow up to be a writer. Because when you live too much in your own head, you neglect the people you love and become an insulated wack job." -- Kristen Tracy

item.title: Karen add a quote by Julius Lester
item.description: "Being a failure at living your own life as best as you can is better than being a success living the life somebody else says you should live." -- Julius Lester

item.title: Karen add a quote by Holly Schindler
item.description: "For the first time in what seems like eons, my body doesn't feel so clenched, so hot. And suddenly, I realize that the dot out there on my horizon line--the same dot everything in my world points to, like in the one-point perspective sketches Mom taught me how to draw--it's not any old spot, you know. It's not some charcoal smudge. It's peace." -- Holly Schindler

item.title: Karen add a quote by Chris Lynch
item.description: "The stupidity of a well-placed "dude" can really defuse a situation" -- Chris Lynch

item.title: Karen add a quote by Michael Zadoorian
item.description: "Why does the world have to destroy anything that doesn't fit in? We still can't figure out that this is the most important reason to love something." -- Michael Zadoorian

item.title: Karen add a quote by Michael Zadoorian
item.description: "You spend your life so worried about what others think, when in reality, people mostly don't think. On the few occasions when they do, true, it is often something bad, but one has to at least admire the fact that they're thinking at all." -- Michael Zadoorian

item.title: Karen add a quote by Diane Ackerman
item.description: "And yet, words are the passkeys to our souls. Without them, we can't really share the enormity of our lives." -- Diane Ackerman

item.title: Karen add a quote by Laurie Helgoe
item.description: "Let's clear one thing up: Introverts do not hate small talk because we dislike people. We hate small talk because we hate the barrier it creates between people." -- Laurie Helgoe
